Edmonton IndyIndex 0: The 2005 season race occurred on July 17, with Sébastien Bourdais driving for Newman/Haas Racing. The car used was a Lola chassis with a Ford-Cosworth engine. The race covered 88 laps, totaling 173.624 miles (279.42 km), completed in a time of 1:38:55, at an average speed of 105.302 mph.
Edmonton IndyIndex 3: In the 2008 season, the race took place on July 26, featuring Scott Dixon from Chip Ganassi Racing. The vehicle was a Dallara chassis powered by a Honda engine. The race spanned 91 laps, amounting to 179.543 miles (288.946 km), and was finished in 1:51:06, with an average speed of 96.967 mph.
Edmonton IndyIndex 4: The 2009 event was held on July 26, with Will Power driving for Penske Racing. The car was a Dallara chassis equipped with a Honda engine. The race lasted for 95 laps, or 187.435 miles (301.647 km), and was completed in 1:42:42, achieving an average speed of 109.498 mph.
Edmonton IndyIndex 5: On July 25, 2010, Scott Dixon drove for Chip Ganassi Racing in a Dallara chassis with a Honda engine. The race covered 95 laps, equivalent to 187.435 miles (301.647 km), and was finished in 1:50:37 with an average speed of 101.666 mph.
Edmonton IndyIndex 6: During the 2011 season on July 24, Will Power competed for Penske Racing, driving a Dallara chassis also powered by a Honda engine. The race was 80 laps long, totaling 180.48 miles (290.454 km), completed in 1:57:23, with an average speed of 90.949 mph.
Edmonton IndyIndex 1: The race took place on July 23, 2006. The driving time was 1:40:30, covering a distance of 167.705 miles (269.895 km) over 85 laps. Justin Wilson, driving a Ford-Cosworth engine in a Lola chassis for RuSPORT, achieved an average speed of 100.112 mph.
Edmonton IndyIndex 2: The event occurred on July 22, 2007. Sébastien Bourdais completed the race in 1:45:41, traveling 189.408 miles (304.822 km) across 96 laps. He drove for Newman/Haas/Lanigan Racing, utilizing a Cosworth engine in a Panoz chassis, with an average speed of 107.517 mph.
Edmonton IndyIndex 7: On July 22, 2012, the race spanned 169.2 miles (272.301 km) over 75 laps, finishing in 1:38:51. The drivers included Will Power and Hélio Castroneves, representing Penske Racing. They drove Dallara chassis with engines from Chevrolet and Honda, achieving an average speed of 101.246 mph.
